intro: Arrabidaea brachypoda var. firma, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features showy yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters. Its root system is notable for containing nitrogen-fixing bacteria, which enhance soil fertility. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
